vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
Included with: πεντηκοστ-ός, ή, όν,
fiftieth, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II substantive πεντηκοστή, ἡ,
__II.1 (i.e. μερίς), fiftieth part: hence, tax of two per century. on exports and imports, at Athens, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; at Halicarnassus, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]; τῶν πρηθέντων τελείτω π. [Refs 4th c.BC+]; = Latin quinquagesima, [Refs 2nd c.AD+] invented a new sort of composition of two per century. in lieu of his cavalry service, i. e. paid this instead of it, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__II.2 (i.e. ἡμέρα), fiftieth day (after the Passover), [LXX]; ἡ ἡμέρα τῆς Π. [NT]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
§ Pentecost, fiftieth (day after Passover)
Pentecost, or the Feast of Weeks; one of the three great Jewish festivals, so called because it was celebrated on the fiftieth day, reckoning from the second day of the feast of unleavened bread, i.e., from the 16th day of Nisan, Acts 2:1; 20:16; 1Cor. 16:8*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: Pentecostés (fiesta judía celebrada en el quincuagésimo día después de la Pascua judía)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
五旬節 这个陰性名詞在原文的意思是 「第五十天」
三大猶太節期中第二大節期, 每年於耶路撒冷慶祝
時間是逾越節後第七個禮拜, 表彰收穫完成的感恩
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
五旬节这个阴性名词在原文的意思是「第五十天」
三大犹太节期中第二大节期, 每年于耶路撒冷庆祝
时间是逾越节后第七个礼拜, 表彰收获完成的感恩
